title: Philippians Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Philippians chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Philippians Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Philippians Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who wrote the letter to the saints at Philippi?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul and Timotheus
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:1 states that Paul and Timotheus are the servants of Jesus Christ writing to all the saints at Philippi.

questions.question: What greeting does Paul offer to the Philippians in verse 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:2 says, 'Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: What does Paul say he does upon every remembrance of the Philippians?
questions.correctAnswer: He thanks God
questions.explanation: In Philippians 1:3, Paul says, 'I thank my God upon every remembrance of you.'

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:4, how does Paul pray for the Philippians?
questions.correctAnswer: With joy
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:4 states Paul prays for them 'Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy.'

questions.question: What is Paul confident about regarding the work begun in the Philippians?
options: That it will be performed until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: That it will be performed until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:6 says Paul is confident that God who began a good work in them will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: In Philippians 1:7, Paul says the Philippians are partakers of what?
questions.correctAnswer: His grace
questions.explanation: Verse 7 mentions that the Philippians are partakers of Paul's grace in his bonds and defense of the gospel.

questions.question: Complete the phrase from Philippians 1:8: 'For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the ______ of Jesus Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: bowels
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:8 uses the word 'bowels' to describe Paul's deep longing for the Philippians in Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul pray will abound more and more in the Philippians according to Philippians 1:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Their love
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:9 says Paul prays that their love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all judgment.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:12, what effect did the things that happened to Paul have?
questions.correctAnswer: Furtherance of the gospel
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains that Paul's experiences have actually helped to advance the gospel.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 1:14 says many brethren became fearful to speak the word because of Paul's bonds.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:14 states that many brethren became more bold, not fearful, to speak the word because of Paul's bonds.

questions.question: What is Paul's attitude toward those who preach Christ out of envy and strife, according to Philippians 1:15?
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledges them
questions.explanation: Verse 15 mentions some preach Christ out of envy and strife, implying Paul recognizes their motives though they are not pure.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:18, what is Paul's reaction to Christ being preached whether in pretence or in truth?
questions.correctAnswer: He rejoices
questions.explanation: Paul states in verse 18 that he rejoices regardless of the motives behind preaching Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 1:21 says, 'For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.'
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: This is a direct quote from Philippians 1:21 expressing Paul's view on life and death.

questions.question: What does Paul say he is in a strait betwixt two about in Philippians 1:23?
options: Having a desire to depart and be with Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Having a desire to depart and be with Christ
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:23 says Paul feels torn between living in the flesh and departing to be with Christ, which he considers better.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 1:29 teaches that believers are given not only to believe in Christ but also to suffer for His sake.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 29 explicitly states it is given to believers to suffer for Christ as well as to believe.

medium.title: Philippians Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Philippians Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged about their spiritual progress. Based on Philippians 1, what biblical truth would you share about God's work in them?
options: God who began a good work in them will complete it until Christ's return
They must accomplish their spiritual growth by their own effort
Spiritual growth is uncertain and unpredictable
Only church leaders complete spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: God who began a good work in them will complete it until Christ's return
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:6 states that God who began a good work in believers will carry it on to completion until the day of Jesus Christ, assuring ongoing spiritual growth and God's faithfulness. This is supported by verses 1:3-5 and 1:9-11 emphasizing prayer, love, and righteousness.

questions.question: How does Philippians 1 teach us about the role of prayer in Christian fellowship?
options: Prayer is an ongoing joyful request for others' spiritual growth
Prayer is only necessary in times of crisis
Prayer should be private and not involve others
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer is an ongoing joyful request for others' spiritual growth
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:4 shows Paul always praying with joy for the believers, highlighting prayer's role in supporting and strengthening Christian fellowship, further supported by verses 1:3 and 1:9.

questions.question: A believer struggles with fear due to opposition. What encouragement does Philippians 1 provide about facing adversaries?
options: Do not be terrified; opposition shows their destruction but your salvation
Avoid all conflict to stay safe
Fight back with the same fear and anger
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be terrified; opposition shows their destruction but your salvation
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:28 teaches believers not to be frightened by opponents, as such fearlessness is a sign of their salvation and the opponents' ruin, encouraging steadfast faith. This is related to standing firm in one spirit (1:27).

questions.question: What does Philippians 1 say about the attitude believers should have toward preaching Christ, even if motives differ?
options: Rejoice that Christ is preached regardless of motives
Only accept preaching from sincere motives
Reject preaching with envy and strife
Preaching is only valid if done by apostles
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice that Christ is preached regardless of motives
questions.explanation: Verses 1:15-18 show Paul rejoices that Christ is preached whether in sincere love or contention, emphasizing the importance of the message over the motives, highlighting a practical attitude for unity and focus on the gospel.

questions.question: How does Philippians 1 describe the believer's perspective on life and death?
options: To live is Christ and to die is gain
Life is all that matters, death is defeat
Death should be feared more than living
Life and death have no spiritual meaning
questions.correctAnswer: To live is Christ and to die is gain
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:21 expresses Paul's conviction that living means serving Christ and dying brings gain by being with Him, encouraging believers to view life and death through the lens of faith and hope.

questions.question: When facing trials, what example does Paul give about how his circumstances affect the gospel?
options: Trials should make believers quit preaching
questions.correctAnswer: His imprisonment furthers the gospel
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:12-14 explains that Paul's imprisonment actually promotes the gospel, as it becomes evident throughout the palace and encourages other believers to speak boldly, teaching perseverance and witnessing through trials.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1, what should characterize the behavior (conversation) of believers in their daily life?
options: It should be worthy of the gospel of Christ
It should focus on worldly success
It should avoid standing for faith
It should be secret and private
questions.correctAnswer: It should be worthy of the gospel of Christ
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:27 urges believers to conduct themselves in a manner worthy of the gospel, standing united and striving together for faith, which models integrity and witness in everyday living.

questions.question: What does Philippians 1 say about the relationship between love and knowledge in Christian growth?
options: Love should abound more and more in knowledge and judgment
Knowledge is more important than love
questions.correctAnswer: Love should abound more and more in knowledge and judgment
questions.explanation: Verse 1:9 teaches that Paul's prayer is for love to increase alongside knowledge and discernment, emphasizing a balanced growth in affection and wisdom for practical Christian living.

questions.question: A believer is confused about whether to live for themselves or for Christ. What guidance does Paul give in Philippians 1?
options: To live is Christ, and dying is gain
Death is to be feared above all
questions.correctAnswer: To live is Christ, and dying is gain
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:21 states that Paul sees living as serving Christ and death as gain, offering a perspective that prioritizes Christ in all aspects of life and removes fear of death.

questions.question: True or False: Paul prayed with sorrow and reluctance for the Philippians.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:4 says Paul always prays with joy for the believers, showing his genuine love and gladness in intercession, not sorrow or reluctance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Philippians 1, suffering for Christ is considered a gift given to believers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:29 explains that believers are given not only to believe but also to suffer for Christ, highlighting suffering as part of the Christian calling and grace.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul says in Philippians 1 that he is confident he will continue with the believers for their __________ and joy of faith.
questions.correctAnswer: furtherance
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:25 states Paul’s confidence that he will continue with them for their furtherance and joy of faith, emphasizing encouragement and growth in faith.

questions.question: How does Philippians 1 encourage believers to respond to those preaching Christ with envy or strife?
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice because Christ is preached
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:15-18 shows Paul rejoices that Christ is preached regardless of motives, teaching believers to value the spread of the gospel above human imperfections.

questions.question: What fruit does Paul desire believers to be filled with, according to Philippians 1?
options: Fruits of righteousness through Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Fruits of righteousness through Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:11 teaches that believers should be filled with the fruits of righteousness, which come through Jesus Christ, to glorify God, emphasizing spiritual character over worldly gain.

questions.question: What does Philippians 1 say about the unity believers should have in their faith?
options: Stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:27 calls believers to unity and cooperation in faith, emphasizing harmony and joint effort in living out the gospel.

hard.title: Philippians Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Philippians Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who are the authors of Philippians Chapter 1 as identified in the opening verse?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul and Timotheus
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:1 explicitly states that Paul and Timotheus are the servants of Jesus Christ who authored the letter.

questions.question: In Philippians 1:6, what confidence does Paul express about the work God has begun in the believers?
options: God will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ
God will give them wealth and health
God will send angels to protect them
God will lead them out of persecution
questions.correctAnswer: God will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence that God who began a good work in the believers will complete it until Jesus Christ's return, showing the theme of divine perseverance.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Paul’s statement in Philippians 1:21, 'For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain'?
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis
questions.explanation: Paul uses antithesis by contrasting 'to live is Christ' with 'to die is gain,' highlighting two opposing yet complementary realities.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:12-14, how did Paul’s imprisonment affect the spread of the gospel?
options: It furthered the gospel and emboldened others to preach without fear
It stopped the preaching of the gospel
It caused confusion among the brethren
questions.correctAnswer: It furthered the gospel and emboldened others to preach without fear
questions.explanation: Paul explains that his imprisonment became known everywhere and encouraged other believers to speak boldly, advancing the gospel.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'in the bowels of Jesus Christ' in Philippians 1:8, considering the original Greek meaning?
questions.correctAnswer: It expresses deep heartfelt affection
questions.explanation: The Greek term 'splagchnon' translated as 'bowels' metaphorically conveys deep inner affection and compassion, showing Paul's profound love.

questions.question: What theme in Philippians 1:29 connects to the broader biblical motif of suffering for righteousness?
options: Believers are given to both believe and suffer for Christ
Believers will be spared from suffering
Suffering is a sign of God's judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are given to both believe and suffer for Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 29 reflects the biblical motif that suffering is part of Christian discipleship, as seen also in 1 Peter 4:12-16.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the motives of some who preach Christ as stated in Philippians 1:15-17?
options: Some preach from envy and strife, others from good will and love
Preaching is done only by apostles
Preaching is always met with hostility
questions.correctAnswer: Some preach from envy and strife, others from good will and love
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges differing motives among preachers—some preach out of selfish contention, others from genuine love for the gospel.

questions.question: Philippians 1:20 foreshadows what aspect of Paul’s future experience?
options: His boldness in magnifying Christ regardless of life or death
questions.correctAnswer: His boldness in magnifying Christ regardless of life or death
questions.explanation: Paul’s expectation and hope reveal his readiness to glorify Christ whether in life or death, prefiguring his martyrdom.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'fellowship in the gospel' in Philippians 1:5 imply about the Philippians’ relationship with Paul and the gospel message?
options: Active partnership and shared commitment from the first day
questions.correctAnswer: Active partnership and shared commitment from the first day
questions.explanation: The word 'koinonia' translated as fellowship indicates deep participation and mutual involvement in spreading the gospel.

questions.question: True or False: According to Philippians 1:27, Paul instructs the believers to stand fast in one spirit and strive together for the faith of the gospel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts unity and collective effort to uphold the faith, emphasizing communal perseverance.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'conversation' in Philippians 1:27 within the cultural and linguistic context of the time?
questions.correctAnswer: Conduct or manner of life
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'politeuma' refers to one’s way of life or behavior, urging believers to live worthy of the gospel.

questions.question: In Philippians 1:9-11, Paul prays that their love may abound in knowledge and judgment. How does this prayer reflect a Jewish wisdom tradition motif?
options: Love combined with knowledge and discernment leads to righteous living
Prayer is only for material blessings
Judgment is reserved for God only
questions.correctAnswer: Love combined with knowledge and discernment leads to righteous living
questions.explanation: Paul’s prayer echoes wisdom literature emphasizing that love must be informed by knowledge and sound judgment to produce righteousness.

questions.question: How does Philippians 1:13 illustrate the historical context of Paul’s imprisonment?
options: His chains in Christ are known throughout the palace and beyond
He is imprisoned in a remote location unknown to others
He was freed immediately after arrest
He was imprisoned without any visitors
questions.correctAnswer: His chains in Christ are known throughout the palace and beyond
questions.explanation: This verse suggests Paul’s imprisonment occurred in a public or official setting, possibly in Rome, where his situation was widely known.

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by Paul in Philippians 1:23-24 when he expresses a tension between living and dying?
options: The tension between desire to be with Christ and the necessity to remain for others’ benefit
questions.correctAnswer: The tension between desire to be with Christ and the necessity to remain for others’ benefit
questions.explanation: Paul expresses a typological tension: longing for union with Christ after death, but recognizing his mission requires him to continue living.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:18, what is Paul’s attitude toward those who preach Christ 'whether in pretence or in truth'?
options: He warns the church to avoid them
questions.correctAnswer: He rejoices regardless
questions.explanation: Paul rejoices that Christ is preached in any manner, showing his focus on the gospel’s spread over the motives of preachers.

theological.title: Philippians Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Philippians Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:6, what is Paul confident about regarding the work God has begun in the believers?
options: God will complete the work until the day of Jesus Christ
Believers must complete the work on their own
The work is for their earthly success
questions.correctAnswer: God will complete the work until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Philippians 1:6 states that God, who began a good work in believers, will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ. This assures the perseverance of the saints, consistent with God's faithfulness (Philippians 1:6; 1 Thessalonians 5:24; John 10:28-29; Ezekiel 36:27; Hebrews 12:2).

questions.question: What does Paul pray will abound more and more in the believers according to Philippians 1:9?
options: Love abounding in knowledge and judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Love abounding in knowledge and judgment
questions.explanation: Paul prays that love may abound more and more in knowledge and judgment, indicating a mature, discerning love (Philippians 1:9). This aligns with biblical teaching on love as the fulfillment of the law (Romans 13:10; 1 Corinthians 13:2-3; Colossians 1:9-10; Hebrews 5:14; 1 John 4:7-8).

questions.question: In Philippians 1:21, Paul declares, 'For to me to live is Christ, and to die is _____.' Fill in the blank.
questions.correctAnswer: gain
questions.explanation: Paul states that to live is Christ, and to die is gain, expressing the Christian hope of eternal life and union with Christ after death (Philippians 1:21). This resonates with earlier teachings on life in Christ (John 14:6; Romans 6:8; 2 Corinthians 5:8; Revelation 21:4).

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:12, how does Paul describe the circumstances that have happened to him?
questions.correctAnswer: They have furthered the gospel
questions.explanation: Paul declares that what has happened to him has actually advanced the gospel, highlighting God's sovereignty and providential use of suffering (Philippians 1:12). This theme is echoed in Romans 8:28; 2 Corinthians 12:9; Acts 16:25-34; Job 1:21; Genesis 50:20.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul’s imprisonment as described in Philippians 1:13-14?
options: It has made the gospel known throughout the palace and emboldened other believers
It has caused the believers to lose faith
It has resulted in his abandonment by the church
questions.correctAnswer: It has made the gospel known throughout the palace and emboldened other believers
questions.explanation: Paul states that his imprisonment has become evident to all, including those in the palace, and has encouraged other believers to speak boldly (Philippians 1:13-14). This demonstrates how suffering can inspire courage and spread the gospel (Acts 4:31-33; 2 Timothy 1:7; Hebrews 12:1-3; 1 Peter 4:16).

questions.question: How does Paul respond to those who preach Christ out of envy and strife according to Philippians 1:15-17?
options: He rejoices because Christ is preached regardless
questions.correctAnswer: He rejoices because Christ is preached regardless
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges that some preach Christ for selfish reasons but rejoices because Christ is preached, demonstrating a focus on the centrality of Christ's message over human motives (Philippians 1:15-18). This attitude is consistent with 1 Corinthians 9:19-23; Romans 1:16; Galatians 1:6-9; 2 Timothy 4:2; 1 Peter 3:15.

questions.question: What does Paul say in Philippians 1:19 will contribute to his salvation?
options: Prayer of the believers and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ
The approval of the Jewish leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer of the believers and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence that through the prayers of the believers and the supply of the Spirit, his situation will turn to salvation (Philippians 1:19). This highlights the role of the Spirit and corporate intercession in salvation (Ephesians 6:18; Romans 8:26; James 5:16; John 14:26; Galatians 5:22-23).

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'to abide in the flesh is more needful for you' in Philippians 1:24?
options: His continued earthly life is necessary for the believers' progress
He desires to retire from ministry
He is uncertain about God’s plan
questions.correctAnswer: His continued earthly life is necessary for the believers' progress
questions.explanation: Paul expresses that remaining alive is more necessary for the believers' spiritual growth and joy of faith (Philippians 1:24). This illustrates Christian responsibility and pastoral care (Acts 20:24; 2 Corinthians 1:8-10; John 21:15-17; 1 Thessalonians 2:8; Hebrews 13:17).

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:29, what has been given to the believers on Christ’s behalf?
options: Not only to believe but also to suffer for His sake
questions.correctAnswer: Not only to believe but also to suffer for His sake
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that believers are given the privilege to not only believe in Christ but also to suffer for Him, reflecting the cost of discipleship (Philippians 1:29). This is consistent with Jesus’ teachings (Matthew 16:24; 1 Peter 4:12-13; Romans 8:17; 2 Timothy 3:12; James 1:2-4).

questions.question: In Philippians 1:27, Paul exhorts the believers to conduct themselves in a manner worthy of what?
questions.correctAnswer: The gospel of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul urges the believers to live worthy of the gospel of Christ, emphasizing unity, steadfastness, and striving for faith, reflecting Christian ethics and witness (Philippians 1:27). This aligns with Ephesians 4:1; Colossians 1:10; Romans 12:1-2; 1 Corinthians 1:18; 2 Corinthians 5:20.

questions.question: What does Paul say about fear of adversaries in Philippians 1:28?
options: Believers should not be terrified because it is a sign of their salvation
Believers should avoid confrontation at all costs
Fear is justified in the face of persecution
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should not be terrified because it is a sign of their salvation
questions.explanation: Paul encourages believers not to fear adversaries, as their opposition demonstrates the certainty of their salvation and God’s judgment (Philippians 1:28). This reflects biblical themes of courage and assurance (Isaiah 41:10; Romans 8:31; 2 Timothy 1:7; Psalm 27:1; Hebrews 13:6).

questions.question: According to Philippians 1:7, why does Paul feel it is proper to have the Philippians in his heart?
options: Because they share in his grace through bonds and gospel defense
Because they sent him material gifts
Because they were the only church he loved
questions.correctAnswer: Because they share in his grace through bonds and gospel defense
questions.explanation: Paul expresses that he holds the Philippians in his heart because they share in his grace both in his imprisonment and in defending the gospel (Philippians 1:7). This illustrates the mutual participation in suffering and ministry (2 Corinthians 1:6; Philippians 3:10; Romans 8:17; Galatians 6:17; Colossians 1:24).

questions.question: What is Paul’s attitude toward preaching Christ, whether in truth or pretense, as indicated in Philippians 1:18?
options: He rejoices that Christ is preached regardless of motives
He condemns preaching done in pretense
He demands preaching only in truth
questions.correctAnswer: He rejoices that Christ is preached regardless of motives
questions.explanation: Paul rejoices that Christ is preached in every way, whether sincerely or out of pretense, underscoring the supremacy of Christ’s message over human imperfection (Philippians 1:18). This perspective aligns with Romans 1:16; 1 Corinthians 9:22; Acts 20:24; 2 Timothy 4:2; John 4:24.

questions.question: In Philippians 1:20, what is Paul’s hope regarding how Christ will be magnified in his body?
options: Whether by life or by death
Only in freedom, not in chains
questions.correctAnswer: Whether by life or by death
questions.explanation: Paul hopes that Christ will be magnified in his body regardless of whether he lives or dies, showing his commitment to glorify Christ in all circumstances (Philippians 1:20). This connects with Romans 14:8; 2 Corinthians 4:10-12; Galatians 2:20; 1 Corinthians 15:31; John 17:4.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his inner conflict in Philippians 1:23?
options: He desires to depart and be with Christ, which is better, but also to remain for the believers
He wants to escape his ministry
He prefers earthly life over heaven
questions.correctAnswer: He desires to depart and be with Christ, which is better, but also to remain for the believers
questions.explanation: Paul describes being torn between the desire to depart and be with Christ, which is better, and the need to remain alive for the benefit of the believers (Philippians 1:23-24). This reflects the tension between present ministry and eternal hope (2 Corinthians 5:6-8; Luke 9:62; John 14:3; Hebrews 11:13-16; Romans 8:23).
